page.title: 01Braithwell-Stainton-Survey
page.content: The land within the boundaries of our Domesday Survey is predominantly an area of farmland.Most of the land is arable,the main crops being cereal, rape and sugar beet.There is some dairy farming of mainly Friesian herds.The population of the area is approximately 1110,centred around the two villages of Braithwell and Stainton.In the North East are small patches of woodland.Limestone is the dominant rock,dipping to the East.In the 19th century Ruddle was an important mineral.Limestone is now quarried mainly for road building. Maltby Main Colliery lies on the Southern boundary and the Barnsley Seam lies under much of the area at a depth of 757 metres.The M18 cuts across the North west corner section. The major road is the B6376.
